description: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Beijing for his first visit to China of his new term, highlighting the importance of the relationship to Moscow following its invasion of Ukraine.
title: Putin Starts China Visit Seeking Xi’s Support for His New Term

description: Keir Starmer will fire the starting gun on his bid to be Labour’s first leader since Tony Blair to win a UK general election by borrowing from the totemic premier’s campaign play book: Printing the promises he wants to be judged by on cards to give voters at events, starting in Essex on Thursday.
title: Starmer Echoes Blair in 1997 as Labour Kicks Off Bid for Power

description: The UK will caution the European Court of Human Rights not to overstep its role, as Rishi Sunak’s government prepares to begin its controversial plan to deport asylum-seekers to Rwanda.
title: UK Cautions ECHR on Migration Before Rwanda Deportation Flights

description: Pop superstar Beyoncé gave Vice President Kamala Harris tickets worth $1,656 to one of her shows in 2023, according to financial disclosures released by the White House that provide detailed information on the finances of President Joe Biden, his running mate, first lady Jill Biden and Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff.
title: Beyoncé Tickets Among Assets, Income Disclosed by Biden, Harris

description: Robert Fico was just doing what he usually does, especially in a part of the country that voted for him. But minutes after Slovakia’s prime minister emerged from a meeting to mingle with supporters in the town of Handlova, he was being rushed to hospital with bullet wounds.
title: Shooting of Slovak Premier Brutally Exposes Political Divide

description: President Joe Biden’s sweeping tariff hikes on a range of Chinese imports are just the latest US moves in a years-long campaign that is rewiring Asian trade routes, figures in the past few days show.
title: US Efforts to Reshape Global Supply Chains Gather Pace in Asia

description: The US Supreme Court reinstated a Louisiana congressional map that adds a second majority-Black district for the November election, giving Democrats a likely pickup in the battle to control the House.
title: Supreme Court Backs New Majority-Black Congressional District

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, global trade editor Brendan Murray looks at what could happen if China targeted its retaliation for US tariffs. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: How Biden’s China Tariffs Could Backfire on Swing-State Workers

description: A Quebec judge rejected McGill University’s request for an injunction to remove a large protest encampment, saying the school failed to prove an urgent need to dismantle it.
title: Quebec Court Rejects McGill University’s Request to Dismantle Protest Site

description: Senator Bob Menendez’s bribery trial began Wednesday with a US prosecutor telling jurors that the New Jersey Democrat took cash, gold bars and a luxury car from two businessmen to perform favors for them and corruptly help the Egyptian government.
title: Bob Menendez Sold His Office for Cash, Gold Bars, US Tells Jury

description: President Joe Biden risks losing a significant share of Black votes in his rematch with Donald Trump unless his campaign improves his outreach strategy, said the daughter of slain civil-rights leader Martin Luther King Jr.
title: Biden Risks Losing Significant Share of Black Vote, King Says

description: Ecuador’s market-friendly government is aiming to provide long-term stability to attract more foreign investment, Production and Trade Minister Sonsoles Garcia told Bloomberg TV.
title: Ecuador Trade Chief Touts Long-Term Stability Plan for Investors

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico is in “very serious” condition after being shot down by an assailant during a public appearance Wednesday, the first assassination attempt on a European leader in more than two decades.
title: Slovak Premier in ‘Very Serious’ Condition After Shooting

description: Argentine President Javier Milei sees his government lifting currency controls very soon as his economic team works to clean up the central bank’s balance sheet.
title: Milei Says Argentina Is ‘Very Close’ to Lifting FX Controls

description: Italy’s government is selling 2.8% of oil giant Eni SpA in a bid to reduce its mammoth debt as part of a privatization plan.
title: Italy Sells €1.4 Billion Eni Stake in Bid to Cut Debt

description: Senator Bernie Sanders is upping the pressure on Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk A/S to lower the cost of its blockbuster weight-loss drug Wegovy, warning in a new report that if prices don’t come down, the medication risks bankrupting the US health-care system.
title: Novo’s Wegovy Will Bankrupt Health System, Senator Sanders Says

description: Israel’s gradual deployment of troops into Rafah appears to be the start of a full-blown invasion of the southern Gazan city, and the threat to civilians and blocking of aid have increased tensions with both the European Union and Egypt.
title: Israel’s Slow-Walk In Rafah Opens Door to Full-On Offensive

description: The US Commerce Department on Wednesday opened an investigation into allegations that solar cells and panels imported from four Southeast Asian countries are being unfairly subsidized and priced below their production costs.
title: Asian Solar Imports Are Subject of New US Commerce Probe

description: The UK government said it’s prepared to push through more reforms to make regulators prioritize finance industry growth, the latest salvo in an ongoing rift between ministers and the Financial Conduct Authority.
title: UK Warns Financial Regulators of Further Action in Growth Push

description: The shooting of Slovakia’s Prime Minister Robert Fico on Wednesday was the first assassination attempt on a European national leader since 2003, when Serbian PM Zoran Djindjic was killed. With Fico, 59, facing life-threatening wounds, the attack raised questions not just for his country but for the European Union, with which Slovakia has had differences under Fico’s leadership.
title: What to Know About the Assassination Attempt on Slovak Leader Fico

description: The European Union backed sanctions on four media outlets accused of spreading Russian propaganda, commission vice president Vera Jourova said in a post on X.
title: EU Backs New Sanctions Targeting Russian Propaganda Outlets

description: The United Auto Workers filed a US labor board complaint over Harvard University’s handling of pro-Palestinian protests, claiming the university violated grad students’ rights as employees.
title: Harvard’s Crackdown on Gaza Protest Violated US Labor Law, Union Claims

description: Dutch election winner Geert Wilders said he sealed a tentative agreement to form a right-wing coalition government after months of talks but hasn’t yet named a prime minister.
title: Dutch Election Winner Wilders Reaches Tentative Coalition Deal

description: The US warned Israel it risks creating a power vacuum across swaths of Gaza and urged the country’s leaders to focus more on post-war planning for the Palestinian territory.
title: US Warns Israel of Power Vacuum in Gaza and Wants Post-War Plan

description: Ukraine reimposed electricity rationing for households and industry as a dip in temperatures heaps pressure on a power system pounded by Russian missile strikes.
title: Ukraine Reimposes Power Rationing as Cold Snap Compounds Russian Strikes

description: A bipartisan group of US House members are proposing legislation aimed at pressuring Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador to back down from his plans take control of a limestone quarry and port owned by Alabama-based Vulcan Materials Co.
title: US Lawmakers Seek to Pressure Mexico’s AMLO on Vulcan Assets

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is placing visa restrictions on hundreds of members of Nicaragua’s government and sanctioning three entities based in the country, part of an effort to tamp down on a historic surge of illegal immigration that has become a political flashpoint.
title: US Sanctions Nicaraguan Government in Bid to Stem Migrant Flow

description: The US will send a delegation of former government officials to Taiwan for the inauguration of President-elect Lai Ching-te, casting the visit as keeping with longstanding practice in an effort to manage tensions between the self-governing island and China.
title: US to Send Delegation to Inauguration of Taiwan’s Next President

description: Democratic Republic of Congo called for an international embargo of metal exports from neighboring Rwanda, whose government it accuses of using rebel groups to steal its natural resources.
title: Congo Demands International Embargo on Rwandan Mineral Exports

description: A Swiss Court on Wednesday convicted a former Gambian minister for crimes against humanity under former President Yahya Jammeh’s regime and sentenced him to 20 years in prison.
title: Swiss Court Convicts Gambian Minister of Crimes Against Humanity

description: Child migration through the Darien gap has increased by 40% so far this year and is set to hit a record for the fifth straight year, a United Nations agency reported Wednesday.
title: Child Migration Through Darien Gap Up 40% This Year, Report Says

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa signed a controversial health-insurance bill into law, weeks before his party faces what’s set to be its toughest election since it came to power three decades ago.
title: South African President Signs Controversial Health Law Before Pivotal Vote

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico was rushed to a local hospital after being shot in what the nation’s Interior Ministry described as an assassination attempt.
title: Slovak Prime Minister Fico Has Been Shot and Taken to Hospital

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said he doesn’t plan to change the military leadership of his country’s armed forces after replacing his defense minister earlier this week.
title: Putin Says Russian Army Leadership Will Remain Unchanged

description: President Gustavo Petro appointed Luis Gilberto Murillo as Colombia’s new foreign affairs minister in the aftermath of cutting diplomatic ties with Israel and as it plans to mediate Venezuela’s political crisis.
title: Colombia Appoints New Foreign Minister Amid Israel Tension

description: Joe Biden’s presidential campaign is proposing to debate opponent Donald Trump twice starting in late June, but is refusing to participate in debates sanctioned by the organization that has sponsored them for three decades.
title: Biden Proposes Two Trump Debates, Won’t Do Traditional Ones

description: Germany’s economy will gain some momentum in coming months, supported by strengthening household consumption, although it will still barely muster growth this year, according to Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s independent panel of experts.
title: Scholz Advisers See German Economy Picking Up Into Next Year

description: Lawrence Wong was sworn in as just the fourth prime minister of Singapore on Wednesday evening, completing a rare political transition in the high-tech financial hub.
title: Lawrence Wong Sworn in as Singapore’s Fourth Prime Minister

description: The United Nations’ atomic watchdog reported that despite the growing presence of inspectors in Iran last year, its understanding of the Persian Gulf nation’s nuclear ambitions deteriorated amid spiking regional tensions.
title: Increase in UN Nuclear Inspections in Iran Can’t Solve Deepening Mistrust

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Equality in Westminster: Is the Government Taking Sexism Seriously?

description: A Pakistani court granted bail to former Prime Minister Imran Khan in a case where he is charged of legalizing billions of rupees of a business tycoon when he was in power in 2019. The jailed leader won’t be set free as he is serving sentence in other cases.
title: Imran Khan Wins Bail From Pakistan Court in Misuse of Power Case

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi’s Mining Stronghold Sees Veiled BJP Rebellion: India Votes

description: President Joe Biden is expected to sign the legislation that will help airline passengers seeking refunds and clarity on fees.
title: Six Ways Congress Plans to Make Flying Better With the FAA Bill

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy canceled all of his foreign trips over the coming days as his commander in chief visited Kharkiv to personally oversee the situation on the front after Russia launched a large-scale assault on the region for the first time since 2022.
title: Zelenskiy Cancels Trips Abroad as Syrskyi Visits Kharkiv

description: South Africa’s ruling African National Congress is likely to win 44.8% of the vote in this month’s national election and will be loath to invite populist rivals into a governing coalition, according to research group Krutham.
title: South Africa’s ANC Unlikely to Ally With Populists, Report Says

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Did Modi Raise Expectations Too High in India?

description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon called for full and thoughtful engagement with China, despite the country posing “tough competition” for the West.
title: JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon Calls For ‘Full Engagement’ With China

description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi piled onto his nation’s criticism of the latest US tariffs, calling them “a classic example of bullying.”
title: China’s Top Diplomat Says US Tariffs Show Loss of ‘Sanity’

description: The US needs to shield Americans from the risks posed by artificial intelligence while promoting the emerging technology with at least $32 billion in annual government spending to stay ahead of rivals like China, according to a highly anticipated policy blueprint from a bipartisan group of senators.
title: Schumer’s AI Plan Urges Billions in Spending to Challenge China

description: The Swiss government wants to be able to sidestep the country’s rigid neutrality to allow more arms exports but will keep stopping weapon shipments to Ukraine.
title: Swiss to Soften Neutrality to Export Arms But Won’t Help Ukraine

description: Dutch election winner Geert Wilders is poised to clinch a coalition agreement for a right-wing government as soon as today, with the name of the country’s next prime minister expected to be part of an announcement later on Wednesday.
title: Dutch Election Winner Wilders Is Close to Sealing Coalition Deal

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken followed up a pledge to support Ukraine in its war against Russia by playing Rockin’ in the Free World in a basement bar just off Kyiv’s main strip.
title: Blinken Is Rocking the Free World at Kyiv’s Barman Dictatorship

description: Britain’s next government will need to find at least £45 billion ($56.6 billion) to stabilize the national debt as the economy struggles with weak growth and high interest costs, according to Bloomberg Economics.
title: A £45 Billion Budget Hole Awaits Next UK Government, Study Finds

description: Russian military intelligence has worked to exploit fringe peace demonstrations in Germany as part of a broader operation aiming to influence public opinion in the country and undermine support for Ukraine, according to European government officials familiar with the matter and documents seen by Bloomberg News.
title: Russia Accused of Using German Anti-War Protests for Propaganda

description: Half of Japanese companies invested in China expect the economy to get worse this year, according to a new survey, and the vast majority don’t plan to increase investment.
title: Half of Japanese Firms Downbeat on China’s Economy, Survey Shows

description: President Emmanuel Macron is imposing a state of emergency in the French archipelago of New Caledonia after pro-independence protests left at least three dead and disrupted nickel production.
title: Macron Calls State of Emergency Over Protests in New Caledonia

description: The Yemeni government is holding back repairs on a key internet cable that’s been damaged in the Red Sea as it conducts a criminal investigation into the cable owners’ alleged ties to the Houthi militia.
title: Yemeni Terrorist Financing Probe Blocks Red Sea Cable Repair

description: China said it would sanction five Taiwanese political commentators and roll out a law to punish “separatists,” moves aimed at piling pressure on incoming president Lai Ching-te just days before he takes office.
title: China Sanctions Five Taiwan Political Pundits to Pressure Lai

description: Macron’s grand plans and jabs at Scholz obscure the fact that Berlin is stepping up its engagement for Ukraine as France stands still.
title: As France Talks Up Need to Act, Germany Quietly Shifts Into Gear

description: A populist turn in one of the continent’s largest economies could lead to inflationary policies that scare off investors.
title: South Africa’s Economy Is Deeply Troubled. It Could Get Worse.

description: Australia has suspended its working holiday visa program for Chinese citizens, ahead of changes which will see applicants from certain countries compete for a limited number of spaces.
title: Australia Pauses China Working Holiday Visas Ahead of Reforms

description: Prince George’s County Executive Angela Alsobrooks won the Maryland Democratic primary for Senate, according to the Associated Press, defeating US Representative David Trone, one of the richest members of Congress, in a race in which he heavily outspent his rival.
title: Alsobrooks Wins Maryland Democratic Primary for US Senate

description: Alphabet Inc.’s YouTube blocked videos of a Hong Kong protest song in the city, days after a local court approved an injunction order to ban the song.
title: Google Blocks YouTube Videos of Hong Kong Protest Song After Court Order

description: The Biden administration is working to send an additional Patriot air-defense battery to Ukraine, people familiar with the matter said, as the US and its allies scramble to meet the country’s demand for more air defenses to repel an intensified Russian assault.
title: US Considers Sending Another Patriot Missile Battery to Ukraine

description: Baltimore County executive and former state representative John Olszewski Jr. won the Democratic primary for the House seat in Maryland’s 2nd Congressional District, AP projected.
title: Olszewski Wins Democratic Primary In Maryland House Race

description: Former Maryland Governor Larry Hogan won the Republican primary for the US Senate in Maryland, AP projected.
title: Hogan Wins Senate Republican Primary in Maryland

description: El lejano tercer candidato en la contienda presidencial de México, Jorge Álvarez Máynez, acapara titulares esta semana, con crecientes especulaciones de que podría convertirse en quien incline la balanza el día de las elecciones.
title: Candidato de México Máynez gana apoyo en medio de peticiones de retirada

description: Mexico's distant third candidate Jorge Álvarez Máynez is grabbing headlines this week, with growing speculation he has the chance to be the kingmaker of the election.
title: Mexico Candidate Máynez Gains Support Amid Calls to Step Down

description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva fired Jean Paul Prates, the chief executive of the country’s state-owned oil company, Petroleo Brasileiro SA, following a dispute over dividend payments.
title: Brazil President Lula Fires Petrobras CEO After Dividend Dispute
